channel.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
channel.description:
HAPPY 15TH BIRTHDAY HALF-LIFE! We here at Black Mesa have some big news![/size]
[b]The Big News:[/b] Last year, Black Mesa was one of the first Steam games to be Greenlit by you, our amazing fans. We've had quite a year since then, with a lot happening internally that we haven't been able to talk about... until now. Black Mesa has been given the opportunity to be [b]sold as a retail product on Steam![/b] This is an incredible honor - one we never expected - but also one we found hard to accept.
We never developed Black Mesa with money in mind. Our team is made up of average, hardworking people, and no one joined the team to make money. For us, Black Mesa is purely a labor of love. We believe this philosophy has significantly contributed to the overall quality and feel of the game.
Our decision to sell Black Mesa rests on two key points. One is we believe we can make the game even better by having full access to the Source engine. This lets us tackle and fix limitations instead of working around them. The second is because frankly, our team could really use the financial help.
[b]The Plan:[/b] Soon you'll see Black Mesa available on Steam for a relatively low price. But we aren't dropping all support for the free version. In fact shortly after the Steam release there will be a completely new free version of the game. We also plan to [b]open source our maps and some game assets[/b] to the modding community!
Purchasing the Steam version of Black Mesa is more about supporting the team and our efforts than anything else. However, the Steam version will include features that the free version simply can not have. We will be paying careful attention to feedback, and you'll have a very real say in how the final game turns out.
[b]Long-Term Plans and Xen:[/b] We've been overwhelmed by fan anticipation for Xen, and we're excited so many people are eager to conclude the game. To be totally honest however, Xen is still a ways off. Over the past year, we have spent a HUGE amount of time porting the game to a new engine and fixing hundreds of bugs. The work to port to the new engine was not because of the decision to go retail, this was work that had to be done to get Black Mesa onto Steam and support our future plans.
So, please be patient with us as we work to make Xen a stunning and worthy conclusion to Black Mesa. Until Xen is completed, we have multiple interesting additions planned for the Steam version of Black Mesa, which we will announce later on down the road.
Thanks, The Black Mesa Dev Team

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: bkdale86
item.description:
JohnWorfin:

Just checking in to make sure there is no new information about the release of the steam version of the game. Carry on

When things have been finalized we will post the information. Don’t expect Xen for awhile.

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: Raziel_ZV
item.description:
Detinator73:

The question is: When are we going to see a release date? And how relatively low is the price point going to be at? $5? $10? Or just $20 for Black Mesa Source? Of course we’re in May right now - and the month that it was announced that the works on Xen was on November - so about 6 months that it was in it’s works. That - I need to know where the dev. blog is for the concept works of Xen, etc.

This is just the beginning of a 2 or 5 (or maybe more) year journey my friend…

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: dazman76
item.description:
Damn, completely missed this news! No rush though, I guess heh

Poised and ready to buy as soon as it hits. (Belated) Congrats on the news guys! Having played 1.0 and loved it, I have no problem paying especially with Xen on the way. Totally justified IMO, and I’m happy to contribute to the team’s upkeep

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
jmxd:

I don’t think “soon” is 4 months or longer in anyones book

“If I’m not back in five minutes… just wait longer.” --Ace Ventura

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: RK1
item.description:
jmxd:

i can see how it may seem that i’m just here to bitch but its more that i’m a big fan of this and i want to buy it on Steam asap since i feel like replaying it but don’t feel like playing the ‘old’ version when the new one is coming ‘soon’.

@subatomic
if late 2014 early 2015 really is true i don’t get why they announce it in november 2013 and say soon but ok

Because shit happens. They aren’t making the game full time and so these things are a guess at best.

Of course you can always make the game come out faster by joining the team.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
jmxd:

I don’t think “soon” is 4 months or longer in anyones book

It is for patient people who don’t come to a community specifically to bitch about semantics they’re unhappy with.

Soon has no set time span, it’s all relative. I’m going to bed soon. It will be Summer soon. Black Mesa will be released soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Birthday Half-life!
item.dc:creator: subatomic
item.description:
For those who waited eight years for the first release, 4 months is nothing. Soon is sometime in late 2014 if not 2015, by my guess.

Read full topic
